content.raw: The test coverage for the new class [is only 88%](https://codecov.io/bb/osrf/sdformat/src/ce848bd72e5b53fba68fc85f8303038e4fe2bb23/src/Camera.cc), while most other SDF DOM classes have > 96%. I'll leave it up to you if you think it's worth it tackling this now.
content.html: The test coverage for the new class is only 88%, while most other SDF DOM classes have > 96%. I'll leave it up to you if you think it's worth it tackling this now.

content.raw: I don't, I'm fine keeping this then unless @iche033 has some suggestion
content.html: I don't, I'm fine keeping this then unless @iche033 has some suggestion

content.raw: I think it's safe to remove the `Note ...` . There is a correlation between focal length and fov. When you change one, it affects the other so I think that’s why the `LensScaleToHfov` exists. If it’s true, then ignore the focal length value set by the user and internally compute a new focal length to give the desired fov.
content.html: I think it's safe to remove the Note ... . There is a correlation between focal length and fov. When you change one, it affects the other so I think that’s why the LensScaleToHfov exists. If it’s true, then ignore the focal length value set by the user and internally compute a new focal length to give the desired fov.

content.raw: Is there a reason not to call this `LensFunction`? The current name is _fun_, but it may be difficult to discover. The style guide suggests that  [Names should be descriptive; avoid abbreviation.](https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#General_Naming_Rules)
content.html: Is there a reason not to call this LensFunction? The current name is fun, but it may be difficult to discover. The style guide suggests that Names should be descriptive; avoid abbreviation.
